summary.p: There is nothing to write, but in the near future, disaster looms; Bullinger should pray with his people for their small church, which the Prince [Georg von WÃ¼rttemberg] does support, but rather negligently manages. Vogler will report more details.

div.p: Last year, if you remember, most learned Bullinger, you gave me the opportunity to write to you whenever the occasion arose. However, since I now have nothing worthy to inform you about (although the present age daily gives birth to something, I do not know what kind of disaster it will eventually reveal; for it indeed nurtures a monster), I beseech and implore you to pray most earnestly with your brothers and the church for the power of the divine to free us from Satan. We and my brothers have a small church under a certain monarch, which has been promoted so far, under whom now almost everything is administered freely and more leniently.
About our situation, Vogler will report. Farewell in the Lord, dearest and most learned brother.
To the most learned and truly pious Heinrich Bullinger, Antistes of Zurich, his dearest brother.
